intro: Silene lycaonica, commonly known as the Lycaonia catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in areas with mild, temperate climates. Silene lycaonica has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer.
